laazotea.indi.driver

Class INDIFilterWheelDriver

  • java.lang.Object
    • laazotea.indi.driver.INDIDriver
      • laazotea.indi.driver.INDIFilterWheelDriver
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    laazotea.indi.INDIProtocolParser

    public abstract class INDIFilterWheelDriver
extends INDIDriver
    A class representing a Filter Wheel Driver in the INDI Protocol. INDI Filter Wheel Drivers should extend this class. It is in charge of handling the standard properties for Filter Wheels:
    • filter_names -> filter_name_1, filter_name_2, ..., filter_name_N (text)
    • FILTER_SLOT -> FILTER_SLOT_VALUE (number)
    • FILTER_NAME -> FILTER_NAME_VALUE (text)
    It is VERY IMPORTANT that any subclasses use super.processNewTextValue(property, timestamp, elementsAndValues); and super.processNewNumberValue(property, timestamp, elementsAndValues); at the beginning of processNewTextValue and processNewNumberValue to handle the generic filter wheel properties correctly.
    Version:
    1.34, November 7, 2013
    Author:
    S. Alonso (Zerjillo) [zerjioi at ugr.es]

      Constructs a INDIFilterWheelDriver with a particular inputStream from which to read the incoming messages (from clients) and a outputStream to write the messages to the clients.

      • initializeStandardProperties

      • processNewTextValue

        public void processNewTextValue(INDITextProperty property,
                       java.util.Date timestamp,
                       INDITextElementAndValue[] elementsAndValues)
        Description copied from class: INDIDriver
        Called when a new Text Vector message has been received from a Client. Must be implemented in Drivers to take care of the new values sent by clients. It will be called with correct Properties and Elements. Any incorrect Text Message received will be discarded and this method will not be called.
        Specified by:
        processNewTextValue in class INDIDriver
        Parameters:
        property - The Text Property asked to change.
        timestamp - The timestamp of the received message
        elementsAndValues - An array of pairs of Text Elements and its requested values to be parsed.

      • processNewNumberValue

        public void processNewNumberValue(INDINumberProperty property,
                         java.util.Date timestamp,
                         INDINumberElementAndValue[] elementsAndValues)
        Description copied from class: INDIDriver
        Called when a new Number Vector message has been received from a Client. Must be implemented in Drivers to take care of the new values sent by clients. It will be called with correct Properties and Elements. Any incorrect Number Message received will be discarded and this method will not be called.
        Specified by:
        processNewNumberValue in class INDIDriver
        Parameters:
        property - The Number Property asked to change.
        timestamp - The timestamp of the received message
        elementsAndValues - An array of pairs of Number Elements and its requested values to be parsed.

      • setBusy

      • showFilterSlotAndNameProperties

        protected void showFilterSlotAndNameProperties()

      • hideFilterSlotAndNameProperties

        protected void hideFilterSlotAndNameProperties()
        Hides the FILTER_SLOT and FILTER_NAME properties. Usually called when the driver disconnects from the wheel.
